title: D-Day anniversary: New images of Normandy memorial released
description: New images of the British Normandy Memorial, currently under construction, are released to mark date.

title: Back-to-school diary: ‘You can throw the ball, but no-one can catch it’
description: When 11-year-old Carl returned to primary school this week almost everything had changed.

title: Coronavirus: Care home residents face steep hike in fees
description: Fee rises of more than £100 a week add "insult to injury" after the wave of infections, says Age UK.

title: The influencers trampling nature - and the man who's trying to stop them
description: Fed up with eco-oblivious influencers, some people have started naming and shaming.

title: Coronavirus: Merseyside's 'forgotten street'
description: The BBC's Ed Thomas visited one street on Merseyside that's reeling from three coronavirus deaths.

title: George Floyd: Fake White House image and protest videos debunked
description: Debunking some of the most widely shared misleading posts and videos about the George Floyd protests.

title: Coronavirus claims 10 of the Royal Chelsea Pensioners
description: Ten of the Chelsea Pensioners have died in the coronavirus pandemic but their comrades soldier on.

title: Yearning for sound of tourists in Alps again
description: The hills come alive again with the noise of mountain railways and cable cars.

title: Coronavirus face mask lights up with moving mouth shapes
description: A games designer creates a face mask that shows animated mouth shapes as you speak.

title: How Bill Gates became the voodoo doll of Covid conspiracies
description: The ex-Microsoft head is currently the target of all kinds of outlandish theories and false claims.

title: Safaris go virtual as coronavirus hits tourism
description: The people can't go to the animals, but some companies are finding ways to bring them into homes.

title: 'Years later, we're still dealing with the same thing'
description: As widespread protests sweep the country, people describe what they hope will make them more significant.

title: 'It doesn't matter which skin colour you have'
description: People of all ages have been protesting, including children who say "you can't judge a book by its colour".

title: Coronavirus: 40,000 UK deaths - what happened?
description: The UK's coronavirus death toll has passed more than 40,000, according to the latest figures.

title: Prince William reveals he is secret helpline volunteer
description: The second in line to the throne has been secretly answering text messages from people needing help.

title: My Money: 'This was not a normal week!'
description: Alex Wright from Leicester takes us through his weekly spending during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Coronavirus: Want to sell a home? Make the garden look nice
description: Property buyers and renters are on the search for outdoor space after lockdown, research suggests.

title: Jordan to donate $100m to fight for racial equality
description: Michael Jordan says he will donate $100m to groups fighting for racial equality and social justice.

title: Madeleine McCann: What is known about the German suspect?
description: Named as Christian B, 43, the man currently in jail has many previous convictions.

title: BBC to show Bournemouth v Palace & Norwich v Everton as fixtures confirmed
description: The BBC is to broadcast Bournemouth v Crystal Palace on 20 June at 19:45 BST as the first of its four free-to-air games.

title: Tim Davie: BBC executive named director general
description: Tim Davie, a former head of BBC Radio and BBC Studios, is to take over from Tony Hall.

title: Brexit: UK backtracking on commitments, says Michel Barnier
description: EU's negotiator reports little progress in trade talks - but the UK says the tone has been positive.

title: Virus cases down to 5,600 a day, household survey suggests
description: The estimate is based on swab tests of people living in 9,000 households in England.

title: Coronavirus: Kate Garraway opens up on husband's battle with 'evil virus'
description: TV presenter Kate Garraway's partner has been in a coma for nearly 10 weeks, after catching Covid-19.

title: Chelsea named Women's Super League champions, Liverpool relegated
description: Chelsea are named Women's Super League champions on a points-per-game ratio, while Liverpool are relegated.

title: Keith Lemon actor sorry for playing 'offensive' black characters
description: Leigh Francis say he is on a "learning journey" and apologised for black characters in Bo' Selecta.

title: Coronavirus: Dementia deaths up during pandemic
description: Deaths due to dementia rose in the first two months of the pandemic, official figures show.

title: George Floyd: Videos of police brutality during protests shock US
description: Cases emerge of police mistreatment amid unrest over the death of African American George Floyd.

title: Chelsea agree deal with RB Leipzig forward Werner
description: Chelsea agree a deal with RB Leipzig forward Timo Werner, whose release clause is reported to be £54m.

title: Patrick Mahomes & Odell Beckham Jr among NFL players calling on league to condemn racism
description: NFL stars including Patrick Mahomes and Odell Beckham Jr have called on the league to "condemn racism and the systemic oppression of black people".

title: Coronavirus: Widen rules on where face coverings must be used, say UK doctors
description: The British Medical Association says coverings should be compulsory wherever distancing is impossible.

title: George Floyd death: Morgan Lake, Chris Lambert and Lianne Sanderson speak out
description: Morgan Lake, Chris Lambert and Lianne Sanderson speak about how they feel after the death of George Floyd.

title: The Papers: Suspect in Madeleine case 'unmasked' in papers
description: Most newspapers report on the latest in the Madeleine McCann case, after police identified a new suspect.

title: The Sweet bassist Steve Priest dies aged 72
description: The glam rock star scored hits with Ballroom Blitz and Blockbuster in the 1970s.

title: Big quiz: Name Europe's 25-goal strikers since 2010
description: Can you name every player to have scored at least 25 goals in a season in Europe’s top five leagues since 2010?

title: Samoan rugby team that set off 104 days ago still not home
description: While waiting for flights to resume, 20 players shared a single room in Auckland for three months.

title: Coronavirus: No return to 'business as usual' for dentists
description: Practices in England can reopen from Monday, but many say they will not be ready.

title: Alan Partridge to return with podcast from Norwich shed
description: The 18-part series will be recorded from the fictional Norwich-based broadcaster's shed.

title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: The older doctors risking their lives to battle Covid-19
description: Though medical staff are in the Covid-19 firing line, there has been a surge of interest in healthcare as a career.

title: George Floyd death: China takes a victory lap over US protests
description: China is hitting back at the US for supporting Hong Kong pro-democracy demonstrations last year.

title: Sitting In Limbo: Brother turns Windrush scandal into a very personal TV drama
description: The brother of a man caught up in the Windrush scandal has written a BBC drama about his ordeal.
